還不如.definition: to be better off ...; might as well ...

還俗.definition: to return to normal life (leaving a monastic order)

還價.definition: to make a counteroffer when haggling; to bargain

還原.definition: to restore to the original state; to reconstruct (an event); reduction (chemistry)

還原真相.definition: to set the record straight; to clarify the facts

還報.definition: to return a favor; to reciprocate; (literary) to report back

還擊.definition: to hit back; to return fire

還是.definition: still (as before); had better; unexpectedly; or

還有.definition: there still remain(s); there is (or are) still; in addition

還清.definition: to pay back in full; to redeem a debt

還禮.definition: to return a politeness; to present a gift in return

還鄉.definition: (literary) to return to one's native place

還鄉女.definition: (Korean term) women who returned to Korea after being abducted during the Manchu invasions of Korea in the 17th century, only to be regarded as defiled and therefore ostracized, even by their own families

還陽.definition: to come back to life (after death)

還願.definition: to redeem a vow (to a deity); to fulfill a promise; votive

還魂.definition: to return from the grave; (old) to recycle (waste products)
